page.title: 02The Houses we live in
page.content: Most of the people who live in the area have two floors in their houses. Some live in older houses with three floors and others live in bungalows. In Kirby Hill there has been a lot of houses built since 1960. The main building material is brick with tile roofs although several of the older properties have roofs of slate. One or two of the older and more important houses are built of stone, usually limestone. The houses are mostly gathered together in the three villages with an occasional outlying farm. In Skelton most of the houses are occupied by people who work in the village for the Newby Hall Estate which owns a lot of the property. In Kirby Hill most of the people work elsewhere and need transport.
